local_schema.longdesc: If true, scrolling one direction through all workspaces is possible.
How often to check for new weather information.
The name of the weather source to get weather information from.
If true, use metric units when showing weather.
The list of weather locations to check.

local_schema.short_desc: Dismiss a stopped timer when clicked
local_schema.longdesc: If false, finished timers will reset instead of dismiss.
The default time (in secs) for any new timers.
If true, all new timers will automatically start.
If true, timers will disappear when they time out.
The currently selected item in the session manager menu.
The number of most recent documents to show.
If true, will try to show the most recent document on the dock.
List of NPR stations to display.
The GMail username to check.
How often (in mins) to check for new mail.

local_schema.short_desc: Show a notify for unread mail
local_schema.longdesc: If true, shows a notify message for new unread mail.

local_schema.short_desc: Show indicator dot for unread mail
local_schema.longdesc: If true, when there is new unread mail Docky will show the indicator dot.
The last time Docky checked GMail for messages.
List of custom GMail labels to check in addition to the inbox.
How much to shift the colour of the urgent indicator. The value can be from -180 to 180.
The name of the current Docky theme.

local_schema.short_desc: Urgent indicator glow animation time (in seconds)
local_schema.longdesc: How long the urgent indicator glow animation is (in seconds), 0 to disable, or -1 for infinite.

local_schema.short_desc: Redirect helper output to Docky's output
local_schema.longdesc: If true, output from the helpers will be redirected to show in Docky's output.

local_schema.short_desc: Show hover text labels for launchers
local_schema.longdesc: If false, Docky will not show hover texts for launchers (but still show for plugins).

local_schema.short_desc: Show windows from only current desktop
local_schema.longdesc: If true, Docky will only show windows on the currently active desktop.
If the 'Pin to Dock' option should show in the menu of items, allowing you to add it permanently to the dock.

local_schema.short_desc: Show Settings in Docky item menu
local_schema.longdesc: If true, the Docky item pop-up menu shows the Settings option.

local_schema.short_desc: Show Quit in Docky item menu
local_schema.longdesc: If true, the Docky item pop-up menu shows the Quit option.
If true, shows the Docky item on the dock managing windows.
Set the colour of the Docky icon. 0 means use the GTK+ theme colour.
The text to show when hovering the Docky item.
The command to execute when left-clicking the Docky item or "" for default behaviour (which opens the configuration dialogue).
If true, this is the first time Docky has run. Internal use only - Do not change!
The dock's zoom size (if enabled), as a percent.
If true, the dock will zoom when hovered.
If true, any windows without launchers will show on this dock. Exactly 1 dock must have this set to true.
If true, the dock is drawn as a 3d dock.

local_schema.short_desc: Sorts the items on the dock
local_schema.longdesc: Used to sort the items on the dock.
The dock's position on the screen. Possible values are: Bottom, Top, Left, Right
A list of plugins that are active on this dock.

local_schema.short_desc: If the dock is a panel
local_schema.longdesc: If true, the dock is in panel mode and will extend to fill the entire screen edge.

local_schema.short_desc: Which monitor the dock is on
local_schema.longdesc: This is the monitor the dock exists on.
This is the list of all the launchers on this dock.

local_schema.short_desc: Indicate when items have more than one window
local_schema.longdesc: If true, items with more than one window have two indicator dots instead of just one dot.
The size of icons on the dock.
The number of extra pixels to pad the hover area on the top of the dock.
If fading when hiding, this is the opacity the dock fades to. 1 is solid, 0 is invisible.
If true, when the dock hides it will fade away instead of sliding off screen.
The dock's hide mode. Possible values are: None, Autohide, Intellihide, UniversalIntellihide
If false, prevents dropping items onto the dock to add them to the dock.
If true, locks all items on all docks so they can't be dragged.

local_schema.short_desc: How long to wait (ms) to update after a window switch
local_schema.longdesc: This is the time (in milliseconds) to wait to determine if a window switch causes a (un)hide.

local_schema.short_desc: How long to wait (ms) before unhiding
local_schema.longdesc: This is the time (in milliseconds) to wait before unhiding a hidden dock when the cursor moves over it.
If true, Docky will check for compositing and warn if it is not available.
This lists all the currently active (displayed) docks, by name.
This is the command to execute when left clicking on the CPU docklet item.
If true, shows time in 24-hr format.
If true, show the digital clock otherwise show the analogue clock.
If true, the date should show on the digital clock.
The theme for the analogue clock.
If true, tracks the mouse selection clipboard. If false, tracks the secondary clipboard.
How often to poll (in ms) for new clipboard data.
How many recent clipboard selections to show.
